arts.ttl: Divided and declining Bulgaria await Ireland
arts.sum: That's the view of Bulgarian football journalist and Tema Sport contributor Teodor Borisov who joined us on the RTÉ Soccer Podcast to share a deep insight into the Republic of Ireland's opponents for this week's two-legged UEFA Nations League promotion/relegation play-off (live on RTÉ2 and the RTÉ Player on both Thursday and Sunday) and also detailed why Thursday's first leg is taking place in the second biggest stadium of the country's second city, Plovdiv, rather than in the capital Sofia. "For (Iliev) it was more important to create a good defence, to have more clean sheets because this was the main problem under the former manager Mladen Krstajic and his unattractive style has not satisfied the football community but everything was OK before the game in Belfast," said Borisov, who also detailed the players to watch out for, including captain and winger Kiril Despodov.

arts.ttl: Character-building performance from Ireland in Plovdiv
arts.sum: Bulgaria, of course, took the wind right out of the Ireland sails with a goal that really was a thing of beauty as they worked the ball all the way across the edge of the box before squeezing it home, in off the post. The Ryan Manning-Robbie Brady left-flank double act was getting immediate success up the left, Mikey Johnston seemed determined to dazzle coming in off the right wing, while Finn Azaz and Troy Parrott had a bounce in their step with both looking lively in the opening five minutes.

arts.ttl: Heimir Hallgrimsson pleased for ‘fantastic’ Matt Doherty after win in Bulgaria
arts.sum: Doherty, who before the game played down talk of a rift with Hallgrimsson, marked his return to the starting XI by heading home the decisive goal.

arts.ttl: Azaz and Doherty earn Ireland deserved win in Bulgaria
arts.sum: It was actually a bright start from Heimier Hallgrimsson’s side, passing with real forward intent with Mikey Johnson and Azaz showing well on the right and through the middle, while Ryan Manning and Robbie Brady were working well on the left flank, the former playing the more advanced roll. Bulgaria were buoyed by the goal, putting Ireland off their game, and they came again in the 13th minute, putting pressure on the Ireland defence leading to a snapshot from Despodov, but this time the keeper was right behind it.

arts.ttl: Republic of Ireland can do 'a little better' after win - Hallgrimsson
arts.sum: Republic of Ireland boss Heimir Hallgrimsson says that his side can "do a little bit better" after their comeback 2-1 victory against Bulgaria in the first leg of their Nations League play-off.

arts.ttl: Doherty winner gives Republic of Ireland advantage over Bulgaria
arts.sum: Finn Azaz and Matt Doherty scored first-half headers as the Republic of Ireland battled back to beat Bulgaria 2-1 in the first leg of their Nations League play-off.

arts.ttl: Matt Doherty winner gives Republic of Ireland advantage over Bulgaria
arts.sum: The deserved victory was a third from seven games under Icelandic coach Heimir Hallgrimsson.

arts.ttl: Matt Doherty winner gives Republic of Ireland advantage over Bulgaria
arts.sum: The deserved victory was a third from seven games under Icelandic coach Heimir Hallgrimsson.

arts.ttl: Dimitar Mitov using Celtic lessons on Bulgaria duty as Aberdeen star fires 'dangerous' warning to Ireland
arts.sum: The Pittodrie goalkeeper faces his Premiership rival in the Nations League as he country bid for Nations League promotion

arts.ttl: How to watch Bulgaria vs Republic of Ireland FOR FREE: TV channel and live stream for Nations League playoff
arts.sum: The Republic of Ireland are facing relegation in the Nations League
